cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 5 miles north of Barbuda and 40 miles north of Antigua
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the northern Leeward Islands, toward the northern Virgin Islands, then passing just north of Puerto Rico and on toward the Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas and, longer-range, Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest approach just north of Puerto Rico near San Juan

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti from the northern border with the Dominican Republic to Le Mole St. Nicholas; Turks & Caicos Islands; southeastern Bahamas; Cuba from Matanzas eastward to Guantanamo
weather_observation.warning_coast: Antigua, Barbuda, Anguilla, Montserrat, St. Kitts & Nevis; Saba, St. Eustatius & Sint Maarten; Saint Martin & Saint Barthelemy; British Virgin Islands; U.S. Virgin Islands; Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra); northern Dominican Republic coast from Cabo Engano west to Haiti border; Guadeloupe
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and the entire north coast of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible; tropical-storm-force winds have a 95% chance of occurring and 50-kt winds a 67% chance within 24 h.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft surge forecast along the northern coast of Puerto Rico, including San Juan, accompanied by large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–10 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 15 inches, capable of flash flooding and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; potential port-side debris hazards due to extreme gusts.
